title: How to Make Butternut Squash and Sweet Potato Pie

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (176 degrees Celsius)
In a large bowl, mash the sweet potatoes and squash together finely.
Puree the mixture in a blender until smooth.
Add the eggs, cinnamon, nutmeg and allspice and mix very well until smooth.
In a pie dish, have your crust ready and pour the mixture in the crust until it reaches about 1/4 inch from being full.
steps.description: You don't want the mixture to bubble over.

steps.headline: Place the pie carefully onto a baking sheet (in case any spillage happens) and bake for 35-40 minutes.
steps.description: Stick a toothpick in the pie and if it comes out clean, it's done.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven and let cool for 20 minutes.
Serve warm with whipped cream if preferred.

text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (176 degrees Celsius)  In a large bowl, mash the sweet potatoes and squash together finely. Mix in the condensed milk. Puree the mixture in a blender until smooth. Pour back into the bowl. Add the eggs, cinnamon, nutmeg and allspice and mix very well until smooth.  In a pie dish, have your crust ready and pour the mixture in the crust until it reaches about 1/4 inch from being full. You don't want the mixture to bubble over. Place the pie carefully onto a baking sheet (in case any spillage happens) and bake for 35-40 minutes. Stick a toothpick in the pie and if it comes out clean, it's done. Remove from the oven and let cool for 20 minutes.  Serve warm with whipped cream if preferred.
